sense.name: theoretical account
sense.commentary: theoretical account, framework, simulation - a simplified description or physical representation of a complex entity or process
sense.examples: The computer program was based on a model of the circulatory and respiratory systems. The model cars were George's favorite toys. Fido kept chewing up the model racetrack.

sense.name: a type of product
sense.examples: His car was an older model than mine. I have a newer model of that computer at home. If you buy the old model vacuum cleaner you can save money.

sense.name: fashion model
sense.commentary: poser, subject - a person who poses for a photographer or painter or sculptor
sense.examples: The president didn't have time to be a model so the artist worked from photos. They told her she'd make an excellent plus size model.

sense.name: good example
sense.commentary: exemplar, example, role model - something or someone worthy of imitation
sense.examples: Every child needs a role model. Fido thought that George was a model of success. A model of clarity... He is the very model of a modern major general. I profited from his example.

sense.name: showing
sense.commentary: MODEL[+event] modelling, modeling - the act of representing something (usually on a smaller scale); [probably rare]
sense.examples: The teacher asked me to perform the model of CPR on the dummy for the class. The model of the procedure lasted almost an hour.
